name: GetCampaignMetrics
description:
Fetch metrics for an individual campaign.

Use this tool to retrieve a list of metrics for a specific campaign. It supports flexible time-based metrics by utilizing parameters like resolution, time zone, start, and end times. The recommended version 2 provides greater flexibility with these options. This tool is ideal for analyzing campaign performance over time.

parameters.name: metrics_api_version
parameters.description: Specify the version of the metrics API to use. Recommended value is '2'.

value_schema.description: The version of the metrics API to use.

parameters.name: campaign_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the campaign to retrieve metrics for.

value_schema.description: The ID of the campaign that you want to trigger or return information about.

parameters.name: metrics_item_type
parameters.description: Specify the type of item for metrics: email, webhook, twilio, slack, push, in_app. Leave empty for all types.

value_schema.description: The type of item you want to return metrics for. When empty, the response contains metrics for all possible types.

parameters.name: resolution
parameters.description: Determines increment for metrics—hourly, daily, weekly, or monthly. Only for Version 2.

value_schema.description: **Version 2 only.** Determines increment for metrics—hourly, daily, weekly, or monthly.

parameters.name: timezone_for_metrics
parameters.description: For version 2 only. Specify the time zone for the metrics requested. Defaults to EST if not provided. Use the region format.

value_schema.description: **Version 2 only.** The time zone for the metrics you are requesting. If you do not provide a time zone, we use EST. You must use the [region format](/journeys/example-timezones/#region-format).

parameters.name: metrics_start_timestamp
parameters.description: Unix timestamp marking the start of the metrics period for version 2.

value_schema.description: **Version 2 only.** The unix timestamp for the beginning of your metrics.

parameters.name: end_time_unix
parameters.description: Unix timestamp marking the end of the metrics period. Use only with version 2. Limited to 10 years from the start parameter.

value_schema.description: **Version 2 only.** The unix timestamp for the end of your metrics. Limited to 10 years from the `start` parameter.

parameters.name: version_1_time_unit
parameters.description: For Version 1 only, specify the time unit for the report. Options include hours, days, weeks, or months.

value_schema.description: **Version 1 only.** The unit of time for your report.

parameters.name: number_of_steps
parameters.description: (Version 1 only) The number of periods to return, with defaults and maximum limits based on the period unit (e.g., hours, days).

value_schema.description: **Version 1 only.** The number of periods you want to return. Defaults to the maximum available, or `12` if the period is in `months`. Maximums are 24 hours, 45 days, 12 weeks, or 120 months.
